conclusion: Consider shadows cast by objects A, B, C, and D on the ground.
Shadows will change in size and position as the light source moves.
Object A's shadow is on the ground.
As the light source moves backwards, Object A's shadow will become smaller and move further away.
Object A's shadow will change in shape, becoming more elongated and narrower.
Object B's shadow is on the ground.
As the light source moves backwards, Object B's shadow will become smaller and move further away.
Object B's shadow will change in shape, becoming more elongated and narrower.
Object C's shadow is on the ground.
As the light source moves backwards, Object C's shadow will become smaller and move further away.
Object C's shadow will change in shape, becoming more elongated and narrower.
Object D's shadow is on the ground.
As the light source moves backwards, Object D's shadow will become smaller and move further away.
Object D's shadow will change in shape, becoming more elongated and narrower.
Summary: Shadows of objects A, B, C, and D will become smaller, move further away, and become more elongated and narrower.
